tool.name: HUMAnN
tool.command:
python "/galaxy-central/tools/hutlab_tools/check_file_size.py" --InputFile $input --Threshold 2147483648 --Error_RC 9 && humann -i $input -o humann_analysis #if $str($gchoice_additional_analysis_types.global_additional_analysis_types) == "1": --search-mode $gchoice_additional_analysis_types.search_mode --prescreen-threshold $gchoice_additional_analysis_types.prescreen_threshold --nucleotide-identity-threshold $gchoice_additional_analysis_types.nucleotide_identity_threshold --nucleotide-query-coverage-threshold $gchoice_additional_analysis_types.nucleotide_query_coverage_threshold --nucleotide-subject-coverage-threshold $gchoice_additional_analysis_types.nucleotide_subject_coverage_threshold --evalue $gchoice_additional_analysis_types.E_value --translated-identity-threshold $gchoice_additional_analysis_types.translated_identity_threshold --translated-query-coverage-threshold $gchoice_additional_analysis_types.translated_query_coverage_threshold --translated-subject-coverage-threshold $gchoice_additional_analysis_types.translated_subject_coverage_threshold #end if
#if $str($gchoice_taxonomy.global_taxonomy) == "1": --taxonomic-profile $gchoice_taxonomy.input_taxonomy #end if && cp humann_analysis/*_genefamilies.tsv $output1 && cp humann_analysis/*_pathabundance.tsv $output2 && cp humann_analysis/*_pathcoverage.tsv $output3

exit_code.description: Input dataset size is too large (Threshold is 2Gb): Please run it out of Galaxy

param.name: global_additional_analysis_types
param.label: Display additional analysis types and arguments advanced parameters
param.help: Select additional analysis types and argument advanced choices

param.name: search_mode
param.label: Search for uniref50 or uniref90 gene families

param.name: prescreen_threshold
param.label: Minimum percentage of reads matching a species

param.name: nucleotide_query_coverage_threshold
param.label: Query coverage threshold for nucleotide alignments

param.name: nucleotide_subject_coverage_threshold
param.label: Subject coverage threshold for nucleotide alignments

param.name: E_value
param.label: E_value threshold to use with the translated search

param.name: translated_query_coverage_threshold
param.label: Query coverage threshold for translated alignments

param.name: translated_subject_coverage_threshold
param.label: Subject coverage threshold for translated alignments

param.name: global_taxonomy
param.label: Display additional parameters for for using a pre-computed taxonomic profile

param.name: input_taxonomy
param.label: Input taxonomy (Max size to use in Galaxy: 4Mb)

tool.help:
HUMAnN is a pipeline for efficiently and accurately profiling the presence/absence and abundance of microbial pathways in a community from metagenomic or metatranscriptomic sequencing data (typically millions of short DNA/RNA reads). This process, referred to as functional profiling, aims to describe the metabolic potential of a microbial community and its members. More generally, functional profiling answers the question "What are the microbes in my community-of-interest doing (or capable of doing)?"
.. image:: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/biobakery/biobakery/master/images/humann3demo-plot2-2021.png :height: 500 :width: 600
**Features** ============
.. _Sample_sam: https://github.com/biobakery/galaxy-upgrade/blob/main/humann/examples/demo.sam .. _Sample_fasta: https://github.com/biobakery/galaxy-upgrade/blob/main/humann/examples/demo.fasta .. _Sample_Taxonomy: https://github.com/biobakery/galaxy-upgrade/blob/main/humann/examples/SRS014476-Supragingival_plaque_profile.txt
1. Community functional profiles stratified by known and unclassified organisms - MetaPhlAn and ChocoPhlAn pangenome database are used to facilitate fast, accurate, and organism-specific functional profiling - Organisms included are Archaea, Bacteria, Eukaryotes, and Viruses
2. Considerably expanded databases of genomes, genes, and pathways - UniRef database provides gene family definitions MetaCyc provides pathway definitions by gene family MinPath is run to identify the set of minimum pathways
3. A simple user interface (single command driven flow) - The user only needs to provide a quality-controlled metagenome or metatranscriptome
4. Accelerated mapping of reads to reference databases (including run-time generated databases tailored to the input) - Bowtie2 is run for accelerated nucleotide-level searches - Diamond is run for accelerated translated searches
**Sample Data** ===============
You can download sample data to your computer from the following locations and then upload it to Galaxy using the Get-Data / Upload file from your computer.
* Sample_sam_
* Sample_fasta_
* Sample_Taxonomy_ (Use the "Display additional parameters for for using a pre-computed taxonomic profile" in the screen)
**Workflow by input file type:** ================================ There are four different types of files that can be provided as input to HUMAnN 3.0 .
By default HUMAnN 3.0 will determine the type of the file. As shown in the figure below, the type of input file will determine where HUMAnN 3.0 will start the workflow. Files of type 2, 3, and 4 will begin the workflow after the alignment steps.
**File Types:** ===============
* File Type 1 (a quality-controlled metagenome or metatranscriptome) 1. fastq (fastq.gz) 2. fasta (fasta.gz)
* File Type 2 (alignment results type 1) 1. sam 2. bam
* File Type 3 (alignment results type 2) 1. blast-like tsv
* File Type 4 (gene table) 1. tsv
.. image:: https://github.com/biobakery/galaxy-upgrade/blob/main/humann/humann3demo-plot5-2021.png?raw=true :height: 470 :width: 800
